name: Park View

reviews.text: We chose this hotel for its proximity to the University, & thanks to the reviews on TripAdvisor, we were not disappointed! Breakfast room is fantastic! and the B&B is always packed :) There was also parking available at the front porch, very convenient! With a lovely park a few minutes away, it was a lovely walk to the city centre everyday.
reviews.title: Lovely House & even lovelier staff!

reviews.text: The staff Nikki & her team were lovely, appearing & disappearing at the most appropriate moments. The gentleman at the hotel was also very kind, playing with our kids everyday.
reviews.title: Good Location and Value for Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good choice, except the narrow staircase for my elderly parents but I guess that's the beauty of staying in such an old but well maintained house!!
reviews.title: Excellent B&B

reviews.text: Overview: As someone else mentioned it is a B and B and not a hotel but it is well managed and presented and we will certainly use it again if needing to stay in Exeter. At between £60 and £70 for a double room, it is good value.
reviews.title: Quiet comfortable and relaxing

reviews.text: Location: We choose it because of its proximity to the University. It takes around 15 to 20 minutes to walk to the main buildings but be advised this is uphill most of the way! If you plan to walk from a railway station you should choose Exeter Central (7 minutes level walk) if you can as it is a VERY steep climb up from Exeter St. David’s. It takes around 15 minutes to walk to the Cathedral and main shopping area and a further 10 to the excellent wharf area. The Gandhi Indian restaurant close by near the clock tower was very good.
reviews.title: Good place to stay in Exeter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Centrally located and a good value. Just up the hill from the main shopping/dining area with free parking on premises. The decor is dated but the rooms are clean and tidy. Wifi is a bit iffy in the rooms, but the lounge area had a good signal. Breakfast was good and served in a windowed garden room. Only real complaint would be the lack of water pressure and hot water in the shower.
reviews.title: A fair budget option

reviews.text: All around, this is an average budget option with no red flags.
reviews.title: Fantastic alternative to the chains

reviews.text: Booked this instead of the usual easy and "safe" Premier Inn option. The hotel is in a great position which is near to the center of town yet tucked away in a quiet lovely side street.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was nice and clean with comfy beds and a small but functional en suite.
reviews.title: Lovely welcoming place in a great location

reviews.text: The breakfast was excellent as was the friendly and personal service, loved the Simpsons waistcoat modeled by the owner who waited the breakfast tables.
reviews.title: Will be back

reviews.text: Good location, perfect for the one night, lovely breakfast, good service and brilliant value for money
reviews.title: 1 nights stay

reviews.text: We chose this B&B because we were attending a gala evening at the university which is very near. The owners were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were spotlessly clean and well equipped. The breakfast was superb. So glad we chose it.
reviews.title: One night stay for 4 people

reviews.text: I had to make a one day visit to my Head Office in Exeter. For such a brief trip, train was the only way to go. I was therefore looking for reasonably priced accommodation in a convenient location for rail and bus links.
reviews.title: Convenient and Clean

reviews.text: Park View seemed to be in an ideal location and at a very reasonable price. This proved to be the case. Even though it was raining I decided to walk from Exeter St David's station. With a heavy piece of luggage and carrying an umbrella this was hard work and i was quite out of breath by the time I arrived. Despite the climb it couldn't have taken me much more than 10 minutes.
reviews.title: Good choice in Exeter

reviews.text: I was warmly greeted and shown to my room. This was perfectly adequate and if there was any comment to be made it is probably that the decor is a bit dated, but then perhaps I have stayed at too many new establishments recently!
reviews.title: City Centre but Quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here two nights - 1st landing spot in UK, after flying into Heathrow & a long bus ride.
reviews.title: Nice little place, good value, easy walk to center

reviews.text: Quite comfortable room. A bit small, but not unusually so for UK B&Bs. Good wifi connection, excellent breakfast. Easy walk into the center of town (10-15 mins). We also walked to it from the central bus station when we arrived - also about 15 minutes. A gentle uphill walk, and quite doable.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.text: We stayed there for two nights and really enjoyed the great atmosphere and rooms of the hotel. The service was very friendly and professional, really Hotel quality for B&B prices.
reviews.title: Quiet but Central Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice, quiet location on a little hill, quite close to the centre with a nice view and a cute little garden.
reviews.title: Great value! Will recommend to friends!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Park View Hotel is most pleasantly situated in Exeter, being only a short walk from the university (i.e. excellent for family of students at Exeter) and only a short walk from the city centre. It is easy to find if one is coming FROM the university. We appreciated our comfortable, clean rooms and the pleasant, friendly welcome we received. A copious breakfast fortified us for our trip into Cornwall (again easily reached by car or train from Park View Hotel). We would warmly recommend Park View Hotel.
reviews.title: Perfectly adequate for a night

description: Family run bed & breakfast, in a Grade II listed Georgian building,noted for its peace and quiet, overlooking BuryMeadow Park. 5 mins walk to Exeter city centre,University, bus and train stations. All rooms have TV,tea & coffee, most en-suite. Free breakfastis taken in a bright dining room overlookingthe garden.
